text: I was wondering if there is anyone using the Service Hub and in particular the Support Form. We opened a ticket about it around 12 days ago with HS support and it still opened meanwhile we think it is quite an important topic. Therefore, we would like to check if only we are affected or it is a general thing

<https://marketlytics.com/analytics-faq/exclude-url-query-parameters>

I am pretty sure this will help you filter those parameters out.
Thanks and sorry for the very slow  reply. I'm not a developer, but I'd greatly appreciate any tips in fixing this.

Hi everyone - I'd like to be able to send out an invite to a slack channel when someone submits a form with their email address. Essentially, after hitting submit I need to access a custom URL. For example if someone enters the email address <mailto:xyz@abc.com|xyz@abc.com>, I need to access "<https://slack.com/api/users.admin.invite?token=dsfhjkdsfah123456&email=xyz@abc.com>". Is there a simple way to do this? Any help would be greatly appreciated.
<@U25C65C3S> set this up recently for his site
Hello!  Using the HS embed code and form global events, is there an event for when dependent fields propagate?  I only see these options <https://developers.HubSpot.com/global-form-events>
We need to localize the labels/descriptions of the form after the dependent fields are added to the dom.

Hey Karis, am I understanding the desired flow correctly?

- Core website is hosted on WordPress
- Some landing pages are hosted on WordPress

1. User uses search bar on HubSpot landing page
2. You want the user should see WordPress pages in that search
3. (this is when I get confused) When the user clicks on a WordPress page, it takes them to the WordPress page? Or the HubSpot-hosted landing page?

Not sure if I understand correctly, but maybe this answer will provide a conclusion: the default search functionality wonâ€™t show content you host outside of HubSpot.
